cards.name: Discombobulate
cards.text: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I said 'pick his brain,' not 'tear off his head.'"
—Riptide Project researcher
cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Dispersing Orb
cards.text: {3}{U}, Sacrifice a permanent: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Like the seas, the Æther is fickle and ever-changing. If we can control one, we can master the other."
—Riptide Project director
cards.originalText: {3}{U}, Sacrifice a permanent: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Disruptive Pitmage
cards.text:
{T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Morph {U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: "Show weakness to hide your strength."
cards.originalText:
{T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Morph {U} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Essence Fracture
cards.text:
Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor:
"Shaping reality is simply a matter of knowing where to apply pressure."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Fleeting Aven
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a player cycles a card, return Fleeting Aven to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Don't become so enthralled with magic that you forget you can fly without it."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a player cycles a card, return Fleeting Aven to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Future Sight
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library.
cards.flavor:
"My past holds only pain and loss. I will conquer it by creating the perfect future."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

rulings.text: The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.

You must follow the normal timing permissions and restrictions for the top card of your library and pay its costs. If it has alternative or additional costs, you may pay those. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.
If the top card of your library is a land, you may play that land only if you have any available land plays.

If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability (perhaps because that top card is the card you're casting) the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
As soon as you finish playing the card on top of your library, reveal the next card in your library.

cards.originalText:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library as though it were in your hand.

cards.name: Ghosthelm Courier
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ghosthelm Courier during your untap step.
{2}{U}, {T}: Target Wizard creature gets +2/+2 and has shroud for as long as Ghosthelm Courier remains tapped. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

rulings.text: It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Ghosthelm Courier during your untap step.
{2}{U}, {T}: As long as Ghosthelm Courier remains tapped, target Wizard gets +2/+2 and can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Graxiplon
cards.text: Graxiplon can't be blocked unless defending player controls three or more creatures that share a creature type.
cards.flavor:
"Attempts to revive this ancient species have not been entirely successful, but results indicate potential for future development."
—Riptide Project researcher
cards.originalText: Graxiplon is unblockable unless defending player controls three or more creatures that share a creature type.

cards.name: Imagecrafter
cards.text: {T}: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Target creature becomes that type until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When Otarians learned not to trust wizards, the wizards learned to adapt.
cards.originalText: {T}: Choose a creature type other than Legend or Wall. Target creature's type becomes that type until end of turn.

cards.name: Information Dealer
cards.text: {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of Wizards on the battlefield, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor:
"One wizard is a suspect. Two wizards are a conspiracy."
—Elvish refugee
cards.originalText: {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of Wizards in play, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Ixidor, Reality Sculptor
cards.text:
Face-down creatures get +1/+1.
{2}{U}: Turn target face-down creature face up.
cards.flavor: "Reality has exiled me. I am no longer bound by its laws."

rulings.text: When you turn a card face up, its controller does not have to pay its Morph cost.

cards.originalText:
Face-down creatures get +1/+1.
{2}{U}: Turn target face-down creature face up.

cards.name: Ixidor's Will
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2} for each Wizard on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Some dreams should not come to be."
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2} for each Wizard in play.

cards.name: Meddle
cards.text: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.
cards.flavor: Strength may win the fight, but style wins the crowd.

rulings.text: Only works on spells with a single target, where that target is a creature. Will not work on spells that target a single creature and a player, for example.

cards.originalText: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.

cards.text: Choose a creature type. If you control more creatures of that type than each other player, you gain control of all creatures of that type. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.flavor: The Riptide Project was perhaps the only school devoted to preventing the spread of knowledge.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, Wizards you control gain "{T}: Counter target spell."

cards.name: Read the Runes
cards.text: Draw X cards. For each card drawn this way, discard a card unless you sacrifice a permanent.
cards.flavor: "The world is a puzzle, and the mind is its key."

rulings.text: You are never forced to sacrifice any permanents. You can choose to discard your entire hand if your hand is smaller than the number of cards you are required to discard.
You draw the cards, then sacrifice any permanents you want to sacrifice, then discard the required number of card from your hand. There is no chance to play any cards in between these actions.

cards.originalText: Draw X cards. For each card drawn this way, discard a card from your hand unless you sacrifice a permanent.

cards.name: Reminisce
cards.text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: "Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges."

rulings.text: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

Flying

cards.name: Spy Network
cards.text: Look at target player's hand, the top card of that player's library, and any face-down creatures they control. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

rulings.text: Only you get to look. You can't show them to others.

cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand, the top card of that player's library, and any face-down creatures he or she controls. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Standardize
cards.text: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Each creature becomes that type until end of turn.
cards.flavor: At that point, the wizards' argument got a lot uglier.

rulings.text: This spell only affects creatures on the battlefield when it resolves.

cards.originalText: Choose a creature type other than Legend or Wall. Each creature's type becomes that type until end of turn.

cards.name: Supreme Inquisitor
cards.text: Tap five untapped Wizards you control: Search target player's library for up to five cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor: "It's hard to fight on an empty mind."

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText: Tap five untapped Wizards you control: Search target player's library for up to five cards and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Trade Secrets
cards.text: Target opponent draws two cards, then you draw up to four cards. That opponent may repeat this process as many times as they choose.
cards.originalText: Target opponent draws two cards, then you draw up to four cards. That opponent may repeat this process as many times as he or she chooses.

cards.name: Trickery Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
• Target creature becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
• Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target creature gains flying until end of turn; or target creature's type becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn; or look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

{U}{U}, Sacrifice a Wizard: Counter target spell.

cards.originalText:
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a Wizard: Counter target spell.
Morph {U} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Wheel and Deal
cards.text:
Any number of target opponents each discard their hands, then draw seven cards.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: You can choose to target zero opponents.
You can't target yourself.

cards.originalText:
Any number of target opponents each discards his or her hand and draws seven cards.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Words of Wind
cards.text: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, each player returns a permanent they control to its owner's hand instead.
cards.flavor:
"Be logical in all things. Do not allow instinct or passion to cloud your mind."
—Volume II, The Book of Insight

rulings.text: If multiple Words have been used prior to drawing a card, then you can choose which one to apply (and use up) each time you draw a card.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, each player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand instead.

cards.name: Accursed Centaur
cards.text: When Accursed Centaur enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor:
"The Cabal mocks the natural order. For its minions, death is just a pause between duties."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

rulings.text: If Accursed Centaur is the only creature on the battlefield, you must sacrifice it.

cards.originalText: When Accursed Centaur comes into play, sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Anurid Murkdiver
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: Aphetto's swamps are alive with the dead.

cards.name: Aphetto Dredging
cards.text: Return up to three target creature cards of the creature type of your choice from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Phage became both executioner and savior, helping others to the same rebirth she had found.

rulings.text: You need to choose the creature type before choosing the targets.

cards.originalText: Return up to three target creature cards of the creature type of your choice from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Aphetto Vulture
cards.text:
Flying
When Aphetto Vulture dies, you may put target Zombie card from your graveyard on top of your library.

rulings.text: The ability can be used to return itself to the top of your library if it is still in your graveyard when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Aphetto Vulture is put into a graveyard from play, you may put target Zombie card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Blackmail
cards.text: Target player reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: Even the most virtuous person is only one secret away from being owned by the Cabal.

rulings.text: If the player has less than 3 cards, all of them are revealed.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.

{1}{B}: Regenerate target Zombie.

rulings.text: It can regenerate itself.

{1}{B}: Regenerate target Zombie.
Morph {2}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: It can sacrifice itself.

cards.name: Chain of Smog
cards.text: Target player discards two cards. That player may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards from his or her hand. That player may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Cover of Darkness
cards.text:
As Cover of Darkness enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.originalText:
As Cover of Darkness comes into play, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Crown of Suspicion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
Sacrifice Crown of Suspicion: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +2/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Darkness, hide my fear."
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
Sacrifice Crown of Suspicion: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +2/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cruel Revival
cards.text: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Return up to one target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Few Cabal fighters fear death. They fear what follows it.
cards.originalText: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Return up to one target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Death Match
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have target creature of their choice get -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Cabal breeds many things for the pit fights, but it never breeds compassion.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, that creature's controller may have target creature of his or her choice get -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Death Pulse
cards.text:
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Cycling {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Death Pulse, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Cycling {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Death Pulse, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dirge of Dread
cards.text:
All creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Dirge of Dread, you may have target creature gain fear until end of turn.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
All creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: The lantern he carried did not light his way—it signaled his approach.

Protection from white
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Doomed Necromancer
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"His sacrifice shall not be forgotten. Now toss his body over there with the others."
—Phage the Untouchable
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Ebonblade Reaper
cards.text:
Whenever Ebonblade Reaper attacks, you lose half your life, rounded up.
Whenever Ebonblade Reaper deals combat damage to a player, that player loses half their life, rounded up.
Morph {3}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

rulings.text: If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Ebonblade Reaper attacks, you lose half your life, rounded up.
Whenever Ebonblade Reaper deals combat damage to a player, that player loses half his or her life, rounded up.
Morph {3}{B}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Endemic Plague
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy all creatures that share a creature type with the sacrificed creature. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Endemic Plague, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy all creatures that share a creature type with the sacrificed creature. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Entrails Feaster
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile a creature card from a graveyard. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Entrails Feaster. If you don't, tap Entrails Feaster.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a creature card in a graveyard from the game. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Entrails Feaster. If you don't, tap Entrails Feaster.

cards.name: Fade from Memory
cards.text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Proper burial is a luxury Otarians can no longer afford.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Fallen Cleric
cards.text:
Protection from Clerics
Morph {4}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: The most terrifying zombies are those with just a hint of their old selves left.

rulings.text: Protection from clerics prevents damage from cleric sources, can't have any clerics assigned to block it, and can't be targeted by the abilities of clerics.

cards.originalText:
Protection from Clerics
Morph {4}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: False Cure
cards.text: Until end of turn, whenever a player gains life, that player loses 2 life for each 1 life they gained.
cards.flavor:
"I do unto others as others have done unto me."
—Phage the Untouchable
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, whenever a player gains life, that player loses 2 life for each 1 life he or she gained.

cards.name: Feeding Frenzy
cards.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Zombies on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: It wasn't as much a strategy as a dim instinct to drown their prey.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Zombies in play.

cards.name: Festering Goblin
cards.text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.
cards.originalText: When Festering Goblin is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Frightshroud Courier
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Frightshroud Courier during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Target Zombie creature gets +2/+2 and has fear for as long as Frightshroud Courier remains tapped. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

rulings.text: It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Frightshroud Courier during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: As long as Frightshroud Courier remains tapped, target Zombie gets +2/+2 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Gangrenous Goliath
cards.text: Tap three untapped Clerics you control: Return Gangrenous Goliath from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Cabal clerics don't heal the sick—they heal the dead.

rulings.text: The ability can only be activated while this card is in your graveyard.

cards.originalText: Tap three untapped Clerics you control: Return Gangrenous Goliath from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gluttonous Zombie
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.
cards.originalText: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Gravespawn Sovereign
cards.text: Tap five untapped Zombies you control: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: The Cabal never expected its creations to create servants of their own.

rulings.text: Since the ability does not have the {T} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

cards.originalText: Tap five untapped Zombies you control: Put target creature card from a graveyard into play under your control.

cards.name: Grinning Demon
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
Morph {2}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
Morph {2}{B}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Haunted Cadaver
cards.text:
Whenever Haunted Cadaver deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, that player discards three cards.
Morph {1}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Haunted Cadaver deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, that player discards three cards from his or her hand.
Morph {1}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Head Games
cards.text: Target opponent puts the cards from their hand on top of their library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into their hand, then shuffles their library.
cards.originalText: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Headhunter
cards.text:
Whenever Headhunter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Morph {B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Headhunter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.
Morph {B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Infest
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It is from Phage that this evil springs, and to her it shall return."
—Akroma, angelic avenger
cards.originalText: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Misery Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Cleric.
• Return target Cleric card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target player loses 2 life.
cards.originalText: Choose one Destroy target Cleric; or return target Cleric card from your graveyard to your hand; or target player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Nantuko Husk
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Nantuko Husk itself to activate its own ability. However, the only thing that will do is put Nantuko Husk into the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Oversold Cemetery
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have four or more creature cards in your graveyard, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The check for four or more creature cards is performed on resolution as well as at the beginning of upkeep. So the trigger may not do anything if there are not enough creatures any longer.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have four or more creature cards in your graveyard, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Patriarch's Bidding
cards.text: Each player chooses a creature type. Each player returns all creature cards of a type chosen this way from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Family plots are so convenient."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.originalText: Each player chooses a creature type. Each player returns all creature cards of a type chosen this way from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.name: Profane Prayers
cards.text: Profane Prayers deals X damage to any target and you gain X life, where X is the number of Clerics on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "We have ways to make you talk, but you have nothing interesting to say."
cards.originalText: Profane Prayers deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life, where X is the number of Clerics in play.

cards.name: Prowling Pangolin
cards.text: When Prowling Pangolin enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice two creatures. If a player does, sacrifice Prowling Pangolin.
cards.flavor: It's always hungry, yet easily sated.
cards.originalText: When Prowling Pangolin comes into play, any player may sacrifice two creatures. If a player does, sacrifice Prowling Pangolin.

cards.name: Rotlung Reanimator
cards.text: Whenever Rotlung Reanimator or another Cleric dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.originalText: Whenever Rotlung Reanimator or another Cleric is put into a graveyard from play, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token into play.

cards.name: Screeching Buzzard
cards.text:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard dies, each opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard is put into a graveyard from play, each opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Severed Legion
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.
cards.originalText: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Shade's Breath
cards.text: Until end of turn, each creature you control becomes a black Shade and gains "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: The grim business of the Coliseum casts long shadows.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, each creature you control becomes black, its creature type becomes Shade, and it gains "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."

cards.name: Shepherd of Rot
cards.text: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Zombie on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"My priests swore loyalty to the Cabal not until death, but beyond it."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.originalText: {T}: Each player loses 1 life for each Zombie in play.

Flying
Whenever Silent Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards two cards.

cards.name: Smother
cards.text: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"I can't hear them scream, but at least I don't have to listen to them beg."
—Phage the Untouchable

rulings.text: A creature's converted mana cost is determined solely by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner (unless that creature is copying something else; see below). If its mana cost includes {X}, X is considered to be 0. If it has no mana symbols in its upper right corner (because it's an animated land, for example), its converted mana cost is 0. Ignore any alternative costs or additional costs (such as kicker) paid when the creature was cast.
A token has a converted mana cost of 0, unless it is copying something else.
If a creature is copying something else, its converted mana cost is the converted mana cost of whatever it's copying.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Soulless One
cards.text: Soulless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Zombies on the battlefield plus the number of Zombie cards in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: "Surrender your soul to me."
cards.originalText: Soulless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Zombies in play plus the number of Zombie cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Spined Basher
cards.text: Morph {2}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor:
"How cute. Does it do any other tricks?"
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText: Morph {2}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Strongarm Tactics
cards.text: Each player discards a card. Then each player who didn't discard a creature card this way loses 4 life.
cards.flavor: "If you can't pay your gambling debts, you just might be tomorrow's main attraction at the Grand Coliseum."
cards.originalText: Each player discards a card from his or her hand. Then each player who didn't discard a creature card this way loses 4 life.

cards.name: Swat
cards.text:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Few who cross Phage have the chance to repeat the mistake.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target creature with power 2 or less.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card from your hand: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Syphon Mind
cards.text: Each other player discards a card. You draw a card for each card discarded this way.
cards.flavor: When tempers run high, it's easy to lose your head.
cards.originalText: Each other player discards a card from his or her hand. You draw a card for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Syphon Soul
cards.text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.
cards.flavor: As Phage drank their energy, a vague memory of Jeska stirred. Then she lost herself again in the joy of her victims' suffering.
cards.originalText: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Thrashing Mudspawn
cards.text:
Whenever Thrashing Mudspawn is dealt damage, you lose that much life.
Morph {1}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: It just obeys you. It doesn't like you.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Thrashing Mudspawn is dealt damage, you lose that much life.
Morph {1}{B}{B} (You may play this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Undead Gladiator
cards.text:
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Return Undead Gladiator from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: The ability to return to your hand can only be activated while this card is in your graveyard.

Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}, Discard a card from your hand: Return Undead Gladiator from your graveyard to your hand. Play this ability only during your upkeep.
